data.title: Catharine de'Medici: Death of Henry II
data.meta_description:
Circular medal of Catherine de'Medici (1519-1589), queen of France, commemorating the death of her husband Henry II (1559). Beaded rim on both faces. 

Obverse: Prof …
data.text:
DescriptionCircular medal of Catherine de'Medici (1519-1589), queen of France, commemorating the death of her husband Henry II (1559). Beaded rim on both faces.

Obverse: Profile bust of Catherine de'Medici looking to proper right; inscribed at edge "KATHARINA·DE·MEDICIS·REGINA·FRAN".

Reverse: Lance broken in two, pointed-end at proper right and handle-end at proper left; inscribed at edge "LACRIMAE·HINC·HINC·DOLOR·".

Probably done at the Monnaie du Moulin by, or under the direction of, Alexandre Olivier and/or Pierre Regnier.

InscriptionsObverse: Inscribed at edge "KATHARINA·DE·MEDICIS·REGINA·FRAN" ["Catherine de'Medici, Queen of the French"].

Reverse: Inscribed at edge "LACRIMAE·HINC·HINC·DOLOR·" ["Tears from this, from this sorrow"].
